alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Sumter County through 645 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cuba, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Kinterbish, Old Mallard Airport, I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba and Ward. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
